channel.title: Hi A little Help with Demuthium 639! Custom titles
channel.description: Hi I have tryed to do it and It works but instead of it having a title like "owner" but it comes out like this ">Owner" And when I open a need client and look at it from another player view it says (skill:34561) after name its really weird need help thanks!!!!

item.title: Hi A little Help with Demuthium 639! Custom titles
item.dc:creator: @omgomgomgl omgomgomgl
item.description:
@omgomgomgl wrote:

[quote=“Eclipse639, post:4, topic:424775”]Since people are idiots and can’t use google, here’s my full snippet from R-S
Okay so I know this has been done already in 634, but I converted it to work in 639.

PlayerUpdate class:

Find

[code]	        appearanceData.writeRS2String(Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername()));[/code]

Change to:

if (p.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("PLAYER NAME")) { appearanceData.writeRS2String("<b><col=ff00ff>CUSTOM TITLE</col></b> "+Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername())); } else { appearanceData.writeRS2String(Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername())); }
To add titles for more than 1 user between

if (p.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("PLAYER NAME")) { appearanceData.writeRS2String("<b><col=ff00ff>CUSTOM TITLE</col></b> "+Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername()));
And

Add

[code]else if (p.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("PLAYER NAME")) {
		appearanceData.writeRS2String("<b><col=ff00ff>CUSTOM TITLE</col></b> "+Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername()));[/code]

So if you have 2 different user titles set it should look lyke this:

if (p.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("PLAYER NAME")) { appearanceData.writeRS2String("<b><col=ff00ff>CUSTOM TITLE</col></b> "+Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername())); } else if (p.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("PLAYER NAME")) { appearanceData.writeRS2String("<b><col=ff00ff>CUSTOM TITLE</col></b> "+Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername()));[/quote]I do all of this but wherever im placing it does not work and I did use google and I saw the same post of your on rune-server…

Read full topic
item.source: Hi A little Help with Demuthium 639! Custom titles

item.title: Hi A little Help with Demuthium 639! Custom titles
item.dc:creator: @Eclipse639 Eclipse639
item.description:
@Eclipse639 wrote:

Since people are idiots and can’t use google, here’s my full snippet from R-S
Okay so I know this has been done already in 634, but I converted it to work in 639.

PlayerUpdate class:

Find

[code]	        appearanceData.writeRS2String(Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername()));[/code]

Change to:

if (p.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("PLAYER NAME")) { appearanceData.writeRS2String("<b><col=ff00ff>CUSTOM TITLE</col></b> "+Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername())); } else { appearanceData.writeRS2String(Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername())); }
To add titles for more than 1 user between

if (p.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("PLAYER NAME")) { appearanceData.writeRS2String("<b><col=ff00ff>CUSTOM TITLE</col></b> "+Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername()));
And

Add

[code]else if (p.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("PLAYER NAME")) {
		appearanceData.writeRS2String("<b><col=ff00ff>CUSTOM TITLE</col></b> "+Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername()));[/code]

So if you have 2 different user titles set it should look lyke this:

if (p.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("PLAYER NAME")) { appearanceData.writeRS2String("<b><col=ff00ff>CUSTOM TITLE</col></b> "+Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername())); } else if (p.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("PLAYER NAME")) { appearanceData.writeRS2String("<b><col=ff00ff>CUSTOM TITLE</col></b> "+Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername()));

Read full topic

appearanceData.writeRS2String("<col=ff00ff>CUSTOM TITLE "+Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername()));
} else {
appearanceData.writeRS2String(Misc.formatPlayerNameForDisplay(p.getUsername()));
}

And also where can I place this in my Playerupdate.java
